questions.question: Which term refers to writing sensational news stories in order to sell papers?
This term claims that Americans should take lands  to civilize the inhabitants

What was the name for Theodore Roosevelt's foreign policy?
Why did some Americans oppose imperialism?

choices.answer: they thought it went against democratic principles

questions.question: What was Roosevelt's plan for the Western Hemisphere called?
how did the US gain the land for building the Panama Canal?

choices.answer: It invaded Panama and took it.
It supported a rebellion in Panama against Colombia

questions.question: What did Roosevelt use as his "Big Stick"?
Which of the following was NOT acquired by the US as a result of the Spanish American War?
Which of the following was NOT a reason for the US to become and Empire?

choices.answer: gain new markets for manufactured goods
to get new outlets for capital investments
to obtain naval bases and fueling stations for our ships
to gain new citizens for this great nation

questions.question: Why was Cuba not completeley independent from the US after the Spanish American War?

choices.answer: The United States sent a governor to run it.
The United States controlled Cuba's trade
The United States maintained a naval base in Cuba.
The United States established Cuba as a colony

questions.question: Which of the following did the US NOT gain from war with Spain?
Which of the following was NOT a reason the US entered WWI?
What were Wilson's Fourteen Points?

choices.answer: A plan to prevent a future war
A plan to gain more territories for the U.S.
A plan to punish the Central Powers
A plan to spread American influence

questions.question: Why did the U.S. reject the Treaty of Versailles?

choices.answer: Americans leaders wanted to maintain sovereignty
US leaders wanted to expand U.S. influence.
American leaders wanted to avoid trade wars with Europe

questions.question: Which of the following did the U.S. govenment NOT do during    WWI to expand its power?

choices.answer: Pass the Espionage and Sedition Acts
Use propaganda to gain Americans' support for the war.
Put German and Austrian citizens in internment camps

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT an underlying cause of World War I?
Which was established by the Schenck case?

choices.answer: freedom of the Press can be denied.
freedom of speech can be denied.
the right to own guns can be limited.
property can be taken without due process.

questions.question: Which of the following represents a way in which Americans did NOT help in the war effort?

choices.answer: increased their consumption of manufactured goods
gave up certain foods on certain days
fought in the war as soldiers

questions.question: How did the war impact African Americans?

choices.answer: They fought in the military in fully integrated units.
The segregation laws in  the South ended.
Many moved to northern cities in the Great Migration.
They gained economic equality with white Americans

questions.question: which of the following statements in  true of the draft during WWI?

choices.answer: Women were drafted into the military
Draftees could NOT hire substitutes to take their place
There was no draft during WWI, all soldiers were volunteers
African Americans could be drafted into the war

questions.question: immediately after WWI, Americans

choices.answer: wanted to maintain the US's role in Europe.
Preferred to return to a policy of isolationism
wanted to punish Germany harshly for causing the war.
